reviewText: Awesome dvd. She is amazing, and her food is always a hit with a crowd! Watch her, study her, then get your tail in the kitchen!! You can go to foodnetwork. com and look up the recipes online ! Love this series!
I am very pleased with the dvd only wish i could get the only volume but unfortunately it cannot be shipped to australia.
I love Ina Garten and I was so happy that they have some of her earlier episodes on DVD.  They are out of print now so I was lucky to pick up a copy here.

I have watched this video several times since I received it.  I truly enjoy Ina Garten and I'm so glad that it was available for purchase.

Thank you!

I cannot say enough good things about this DVD set. Not only do you get hours and hours of entertaining, but Ina is so pleasant and loves what she does and that comes through in this DVD set. The recipes are fabulous, my favorites!.. Linguine with Shrimp Scampi, and her Cheddar Corn Chowder. I have never had corn chowder this good, I've already made this chowder 2 times. Serve it with baguette, lightly buttered and toasted in the oven. I've made the Linguine with Shrimp Scampi twice and each bite has you coming back for more especially since it has lemons, and a little lemon juice in the mix.
Great dvd of one of my favorite cooking shows.  Glad to find this on amazon.com as it seems to be out of print

I wish she would release more DVDs.  These are discontinued and luckily i was able to find one on here after searching all over the place.  I watch her show on Food Network everyday and can't get enough of it!
ina garten is amazing i love her show especially the early episodes i wish if there a new dvd :)
This book is excellent. I have always liked watching her on tv. Her recipes are very easy to follow and are delicious!

Barefoot Contessa with Ina Garten is a three disc set with three full meals on each disc. In my opinion a lot of space is wasted on each disc which could have been used so much better .The content of the DVD's is very good and I am a big fan of Ina Garten's approach to preparing food but I am not at all happy with my purchase on a value for money basis. I would have much prefered to purchase one of her cook books.

I got this as a gift from a friend who knew I was an Ina fan. This set is basically a three-disc compilation of nine episodes of her Food Network show. They're from earlier in the show, so better than the more recent "Back to Basics" thing that she has been doing. There are a lot of recipes included, about 4-5 per episode so you're getting a good 40 or so recipes, all of which look delicious and are deceptively simple.

Buy this if you don't have regular access to Food Network to watch reruns of Barefoot Contessa; otherwise, get a cookbook, which would be an easier reference than a DVD.
